meanings.definition: The quality of being calm and even-tempered.
meanings.sent1: Her equability in handling stressful situations impressed everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: His equability during the storm helped keep the team focused and composed.
meanings.sent3: The equability of the cat in the chaotic house made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The equability of the old oak tree in the face of strong winds was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The equability of the lake's surface mirrored the clear sky above.

meanings.definition: The ability to maintain a steady and consistent state.
meanings.sent1: The equability of the clock's ticking was soothing in the silent room.
meanings.sent2: The equability of his heartbeat indicated a sense of inner peace.
meanings.sent3: The equability of the car's speed made the long journey feel shorter.
meanings.sent4: The equability of the river's flow symbolized the constancy of nature.
meanings.sent5: The equability of the pendulum's swing was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The state of being fair and impartial.
meanings.sent1: The judge's equability in delivering verdicts earned respect from all.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's equability in grading assignments ensured fairness for all students.
meanings.sent3: The equability of the referee's decisions kept the game free from disputes.
meanings.sent4: The equability of the scales of justice represented equality for all.
meanings.sent5: The equability of the committee's decisions promoted trust among members.
